wikipedia_page.main: Robert "Bob" Wood (14 November 1872 – 1 March 1928) was an English rugby union, and professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1890s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for England, and at club level for Liversedge, as a half-back, i.e. number 9, or 10 and representative level rugby league (RL) for Yorkshire, and at club level for Wakefield Trinity (Heritage No. 2), as a wing, stand-off, or scrum-half, i.e. number 2 or 5, 6, or 7. Prior to Thursday 29 August 1895, Liversedge, and Wakefield Trinity were both rugby union clubs.
